Name: Evaristo Campos
Bio: Evaristo is an Electrical Engineering and Innovation & Entrepreneurship student from Belo Horizonte, Brazil. He is excited to put his networking and data analysis skills to use as this year’s Director of Corporate Relations. Evaristo interned at Wabtec Corporation in the past and is actively looking for future experience opportunities. He works in Dr. Hall’s optoelectronics lab with holography and is a TA for the First-Year Engineering Program. Furthermore, Evaristo is the Vice-President of the ND IEEE Student Chapter and enjoys Football Saturdays more than anyone else.

Name: Madeline Mitchell
Bio: Madeline is a sophomore Mechanical Engineer with an intended minor in Business Corporate Practice or Industrial Design. She is from Fort Mitchell, KY, but she lives in Johnson Family Hall with her freshman-year random roommate and best friends! Around campus, she also serves as a Resident Hall Clerk, Student Worker at the Sara Bea Testing Center, and is this year's Business Manager for NDSEED (an engineering club that fundraises, plans, and constructs a pedestrian footbridge for rural communities in South America). Madeline cannot wait to use her marketing and social media knowledge to help grow ELC's platforms and emphasize outreach to future, current, and past Notre Dame Engineers!

Name: Jessica Perez
Bio: Jessica Perez is a Junior Environmental Engineering major with minors in ILS and Earth Sciences from Columbus, Ohio.  Jessica Perez is a junior from Columbus, Ohio, majoring in Environmental Engineering with minors in ILS and Earth Sciences. Her interests lie at the intersection of science and environmental policy, which she explores as a research assistant for the Kellogg Institute and McGillis Lab, focusing on water quality in the St. Joseph River. Through SPN, she is also working on a policy project analyzing the environmental effects of large data centers. Jessica tutors for the Galvin Scholars Program and volunteers at Casa de Amistad. In her free time she works as the sustainability commissioner and dorm ambassador for Welsh Family Hall.

Name: Bobby Devitt
Bio: I am a sophomore engineering student at the University of Notre Dame and currently serve as Junior Director for the Engineering Leadership Council, after previously being part of the First Year Engineering Council. Beyond campus, I mentor high-achieving, low-income high school students through Matriculate, reflecting my commitment to service and mentorship. Guided by faith and driven by a passion for innovation, I strive to use my technical skills and leadership experiences to make a positive impact. Outside of academics, I enjoy lifting, which continues to teach me discipline, consistency, and personal growth.
